channel.title: progress update on OpenFF
channel.description: Recent content in progress update on OpenFF

item.title: 5th Open Force Field Workshop (2022)
item.description: On June 28, 2022 we had our 5th annual meeting. The event is designed to provide an accurate overview of the progress of all projects under the OpenFF umbrella. This year we had lines from David Mobley, Jeff Wagner, Lily Wang and Diego Nolasco. If you want to know more about everything that happened in the last year, watch the workshop on Youtube and access the slides on Zenodo. Please use Zenodo DOI if you want to cite any material presented in this talk.

item.title: 4th Open Force Field Workshop Series (2021)
item.description: Our 4th annual workshop took place on June 11, 2021 in virtual space. Based on the feedback from the participants in this keynote event, we organized two follow-up workshops in September providing a more detailed overview of the benchmarking practices and results, and bespoke fitting infrastructure. 1. Benchmarking (Sep 1, 2021) The first follow-up workshop provided an overview of the methods used for the Season 1 of benchmarking and analysis of results from the private and public sets, and summarized progress on protein-ligand benchmarking.

item.title: 4th Open Force Field Workshop (2021)
item.description: Our 4th annual workshop took place on June 11, 2021 in virtual space. This was a short and not widely advertised event to provide an update to our pharma partners and collaborators about the progress made in the past year. The latest advances in OpenFF infrastructure and force field research were presented by Jeffrey Wagner, Simon Boothroyd and David Mobley. In summary, there is a lot going on, but check out the presentation video and slides on Zenodo or Youtube for more details.
